metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0033 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
org/apache/catalina/connector/CoyoteAdapter.java in Apache Tomcat 6.0.33 through 6.0.37 does not consider the disableURLRewriting setting when handling a session ID in a URL, which allows remote attackers to conduct session fixation attacks via a crafted URL.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0033` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet2.4-java - 6.0.39-1
libservlet2.5-java - 6.0.39-1
libtomcat6-java - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6 - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6-admin - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6-common - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6-examples - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6-extras - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6-user - 6.0.39-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat6 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.39-1').
